block.command_block.1.command.3: If you place a damaged item in the Runeforge, you cannot modify it with runes. Instead, you can repair the item by pressing the button. Repairing costs levels and certain materials, depending on the item's original crafting cost.
block.command_block.2.command.2: Read BOTH of these books to learn how to
block.command_block.2.command.3: craft and repair items using the Runeforge!
block.command_block.3.command.3: You can modify weapons and tools made from stone, iron, diamond, and netherite. In addition, you can modify armor made from leather, chainmail, iron, diamond, and netherite.
block.command_block.3.command.5: Place the base item in the middle of the Runeforge (there is an invisible armorstand). Then place prefix / suffix / upgrade runes on the forward-facing side of the netherite blocks (there are invisible item frames).
block.command_block.3.command.7: Runes are NOT consumed when you craft an item. You can use the same rune over and over again as long as you have enough crafting currency. The rarity of a rune / item has no effect other than color and "flavor".
block.command_block.3.command.9: You can modify items as long as they are missing either a prefix, suffix, or upgrade. Items that have all three of these can no longer be modified. You can add modifiers one by one, or all at once.
block.command_block.3.command.11: The crafting cost (lapis and/or amethyst shards) is displayed in front of the Runeforge. When you press the button to complete the crafting, the crafting material is removed from your inventory.
block.command_block.3.command.13: Some runes require so-called Runepower. You gain +1 Rune Power everytime you place an emerald block on the Bonus Monument. As long as you do not rush through most of the map, you can basically ignore this requirement.

events.functions.map_start.youtuber_mess: If you are a Youtuber or Streamer, please
to learn more about music in this map and potential copyright claims!

In certain sections of this map, music is a critical part of the experience. While 95% of the map should not cause any issues when uploading and monetizing videos to Youtube, a few of the songs may trigger a copyright message. Importantly, this does NOT result in a copyright STRIKE! You can find simple instructions on how to obtain permission to monetize these videos on Fesliyanstudios.com

Alternatively, you can turn down ambient music and/or boss music with the corresponding sliders in the Sound menu. It is HIGHLY recommended not to mess with these sound settings if you want to experience the map as intended.

item.written_book.1.lore.0.1: Some pages ripped out of Edwin's diary.
item.written_book.1.lore.2.1: There are multiple of these books hidden
item.written_book.1.page.0.1: I think I am losing my mind. For a second, I thought I heard someone call my name. Maybe just the wind? I need to get out of here, but they are looking for me. I have enough supplies to survive until my hair turns gray, and enough arrows to shoot anyone trying to enter
item.written_book.1.page.1.1: my hideout. Is this my life from now on? No ... no ... I will make another run for it tomorrow ...
item.written_book.2.page.0.1: I should not have gone near that castle. These Illagers are scarier that any monster I have encountered so far. And what's worse, they seem to be following me whenever I go out to explore. How do they keep finding me? Maybe they have magical powers,
item.written_book.2.page.1.1: some kind of sixth sense? Last night I heard screams from inside the castle. Minutes later, a gang of Illagers left the castle, their swords were red with blood. Executions? Human sacrifice? Some kind of ritual? I cannot let them find me ...
item.written_book.3.page.0.1: I am disappointed by the lack of valuable treasures I have found. After weeks of running back and fourth between my hideout and various caves and ruins, I have only found rotten food and damaged weapons. Maybe I should be more daring and explore near
item.written_book.3.page.1.1: that giant, intimidating castle. There MUST be some treasures in there, right??? In fact, the blue stones inside the eye sockets of that giant skull look like they are made of lapis lazuli. I need to get closer so I can get a better look ...
item.written_book.4.page.0.1: When I first entered this cave, I was in awe. The old stories were true: A whole world hidden beneath the ground, filled with invaluable treasures and dangerous monsters. To be honest, I could do without the latter. I have built this little hideout so I can get some sleep inbetween
item.written_book.4.page.1.1: my adventures. No need to go back to the overworld! I even placed some brown carpet to make it feel like home. So far, I have been able to avoid the monsters lurking in this cave. That large castle in the distance scares me, though. I am staying away from that one for now ...
item.written_book.5.page.0.1: Recipe for spicy pumpkin stew: Fill half the cauldron with pumpkins, a quarter with crushed roots, a fifth with flour, and the rest with warped fungi. Stir until the stew is thick and orange. Boil for one hour, and add a handful of mangrove leaves. The perfect pumpkin stew!
item.written_book.6.page.0.1: I spent my third night in a row hiding in here. Ever since the Illagers have spotted me, they have been looking for me. I have no idea what they intend to do with me after they catch me, but I do not want to find out. Last time they saw me, I ran away so fast
item.written_book.6.page.1.1: that I almost blacked out from exhaustion. I think I am going to abandon this hideout the next chance I get. I need to find a better hiding spot, far away from those creepy Illagers ...
item.written_book.10.lore.0.1: An Encyclopedia of all notable creatures
item.written_book.10.lore.1.1: and environmental threats you encounter on
item.written_book.10.lore.4.1: New entries will be added automatically.
item.written_book.15.page.0.1: And the lord said: All reptiles shall live in peace with each other, whether two-legged or four-legged, whether grunting or hissing. And thus, the bastion was built: An eternal monument to reptilian unity.
item.written_book.16.lore.0.1: An old journal left by an adventurer.
item.written_book.16.page.0.1: When I jumped into the pink water, I suddenly felt a rush of energy. My wounds healed almost instantly, and I felt stronger than ever before. Hostile creatures, however, seem to wither away as they touch the water ...
item.written_book.17.page.0.1:
I have been traveling for two weeks, looking for treasures. So far I have found ... two spider eyes, an old painting, and a golden hoe.
An underwhelming outcome! I will keep going until I find something more valuable. I know this time will be different ...
item.written_book.23.page.0.1: It looks like there are only two ways to survive: Stay out of sight, or be fast and dodge ...
item.written_book.24.page.0.1: I don't know which ones are scarier: The ones with four legs, or the ones with two legs. Clearly the two-legged ones are more intelligent, in fact it appears they have mastered the art of crafting weapons and armour ...
item.written_book.25.page.0.1: I gave up counting how many laws of nature this place defies. It is fascinating and terrifying at the same time ...
item.written_book.26.page.0.1: I climbed all the way down, until I could barely see the sky anymore. I wonder which horrifying creatures these giant bones originate from, but I am glad they appear to have gone extinct. I will try to find the entrance to the temple tomorrow ...
item.written_book.27.page.0.1: I don't know if these humanoid creatures are just naturally belligerent, or if their constant drinking makes them aggressive. They seem to be brewing their own beer. It does not look appetizing, but I admit I am curious how it tastes. I will try to sneak
item.written_book.27.page.1.1: into their fortress and snatch some of their beer bottles tomorrow ...
item.written_book.28.page.0.1: Now that I have enchanted my helmet, I can finally explore this area ...
item.written_book.29.page.0.1: I managed to run back to my hideout. I swear I can hear them searching for me outside ...
item.written_book.30.page.0.1: I will try to sneak in through the side entrance today. I hope they don't notice me. And if they do, I hope they've had lunch already ...
item.written_book.31.page.0.1: I wonder what kind of civilization used to live here. Whoever it was, it appears that their restless spirits are still haunting these ruins ...
item.written_book.32.page.0.1: Someone must have used several dozen stacks of bone meal down here ...
item.written_book.33.page.0.1: Three of them are mostly intact, but the other one is almost completely destroyed. I almost slipped trying to reach the bottom floor. That would have been certain death ...
item.written_book.34.page.0.1: The deeper I climb, the colder it gets ...
item.written_book.35.page.0.1: I knew I had to fulfill the prophecy, but I had no idea what kind of odyssey I was in for. That corrupted town was bad enough, but it was nothing compared to what came after. Deep in the desert, I faced flesh-eating scarabs and skeletons wielding burning swords.
item.written_book.35.page.1.1: There were two-legged axe-wielding reptiles living in the swamp, and undead creatures were roaming the mines above. I fought a crazed sorcerer who was using the powers of the elements to torment me, and I managed to steal his only enchantment table!
item.written_book.35.page.2.1: Past the dormant volcano, I found ruins inhabited by invulnerable phantoms, and a hidden temple occupied by mad cultists who were obsessed with fire and blood. Deep inside the frozen cave, I summoned the legendary demon Yaaros, ending a century of Winter.
item.written_book.35.page.3.1: But nothing could have prepared me for that damnable witch Alyria and her withering spells. The intense pain and suffering almost drove me into madness! With my last glimpse of sanity remaining, I fought through the cursed exile. The dark lord Aris tricked me and
item.written_book.35.page.4.1: stole the black crystal, but I followed him to his forsaken realm of darkness. When I finally slayed him, I knew I had fulfilled the prophecy! The light was brought back to the world, and the long night had ended.
item.written_book.36.page.0.1: When I woke up inside my own grave, I was grateful that I was given a second chance at life. That was until I realized where I was! Slowly I fought my way through the graveyard, and I made it to the Nexus. I found a few hours of peace, but I knew I had to move on.
item.written_book.36.page.1.1: I fought angry dwarves, undead prisoners, and fiery abominations. And just when I thought I had seen everything, I encountered invulnerable charged creepers inhabiting a cave filled with explosives! Somehow, I made it through the cave, and I
item.written_book.36.page.2.1: decided to rest after staying awake for three days in a row. When I fell asleep, I had three vivid nightmares where I had to face my biggest fears. I woke up, scared and confused, but I knew I had to keep moving. After fighting the Netherhorde one by one,
item.written_book.36.page.3.1: I found Protox hidden in the giant netherbrick castle. It was an intense fight, but somehow I overpowered him in the end. And finally, after all this time, I was able to get some good sleep. No more insomnia ...
item.written_book.37.page.0.1: I followed the corrupted path, all the way through the treacherous sandstone caves inhabited by zombies and reptiles. The mines appeared to be abandoned at first, but then I saw skeletons riding minecarts and creepers falling from the cave ceiling.
item.written_book.37.page.1.1: When I swam through the lake below the cursed forest, I heard a ghastly scream from the distance. Seconds later, I saw a fireball flying towards me, and I barely escaped by diving deeper into the water. I came across a large battlefield full of
item.written_book.37.page.2.1: mines and dangerous traps. Later, I found a surreal-looking zoo filled with gruesome creatures. I managed to run through the giant, ancient halls straight into the nether portal, just to be dropped into a hellscape made of scattered platforms. When I thought I had made it
item.written_book.37.page.3.1: to the end of the path, I was faced with giant zombies carrying spawners on their heads. At last, I managed to make it to the end ... alive, but scarred forever by my experiences. I should have listened when they told me to skip this one.

mobs.functions.elite.overseer_minion_hit: These crystals are invulnerable! You must kill their overseer to destroy them.
mobs.functions.elite.runekeeper_dead.4: You have killed a Runekeeper. Three Runekeepers remaining!
mobs.functions.elite.runekeeper_dead.8: That was a tough battle! I don't know what will happen if I kill all of these, but somehow I feel like my bravery will be rewarded.
mobs.functions.elite.runekeeper_dead.9: You have killed a Runekeeper. Two Runekeepers remaining!
mobs.functions.elite.runekeeper_dead.10: You have killed a Runekeeper. One Runekeeper remaining!

mobs.functions.elite.runekeeper_dead.13: for a bonus reward ... if you can find it!
mobs.functions.non_elite.wraith_attack.2: You were hit by a Wraith. All your buffs have been removed.
mobs.functions.trident_shield_trigger.2: This enemy has a magical shield that destroys incoming tridents.
npc.functions.r1_villagers.alchemist_1.3: Don't believe the rumors! My potions have absolutely no side effects. Just ... try not to drink them at midnight, you understand?
npc.functions.r1_villagers.aristotle_1.3: I feel like moving from Sierhaven to this place was a monumental mistake.
I hit chain with hammer, make armor. Armor protect! Armor good!
npc.functions.r1_villagers.farmer_1.3: NO, I will NOT tell you where I have set up my farm! If you want food, you pay, simple as that!
npc.functions.r1_villagers.jack_1.3: I couldn't decide what to become, so I became everything.
npc.functions.r1_villagers.lennard_1.3: What can I say? I just really like leather.
npc.functions.r1_villagers.ronan_1.3: You're new here, aren't you? Welcome to Sanctuary!
npc.functions.r1_villagers.ronan_1.7: What is this place? I didn't expect to encounter anyone down here who isn't trying to kill me.
npc.functions.r1_villagers.ronan_2.3: People find their way down here for all kinds of reasons. Some get lost and randomly stumble their way into this cave, some come here to escape from whoever is looking for them in the overworld, and others come here looking for mythical treasures. You look like the latter.
npc.functions.r1_villagers.ronan_2.7: Is it that obvious? I was led here by Shade.
npc.functions.r1_villagers.ronan_3.3: I don't know who or what that is. But if you want to go on an adventure, you better visit some of the traders and stock up on supplies. Most who pass the wooden gate don't make it back alive ...
DAMMIT! I was so close, but then I died again. And somehow, I keep waking up right here ...
You're ... not a cannibal! Oh god, please get me out of here!
Don't worry, you will be out of here in no time!
I owe you my life! Here, take one of my famous potions. May it help you annihilate your enemies!
You have received a reward: Goliath Juice
npc.functions.r2_villagers.blacksmith_a1: Hey! You! Please save me! I'm Agent Wildfire, the legendary blacksmith.
Agent Wildfire? You know what ... I'm not even going to question that choice of name. Let's get out of here!
npc.functions.r2_villagers.blacksmith_c1: I, the legendary blacksmith, must thank you for your good deed! The world would have been a darker place without Agent Wildfire.
You have received a reward: 16 Iron Ingots
WHO ARE YOU!? You look different than the other cannibals. Please don't eat me!
I'm here to rescue you! Quick, before the cannibals come back!
Thank you! I'm sorry for thinking you were a cannibal. As a token of my gratitude, take some of my precious amethyst shards!
You have received a reward: 16 Amethyst Shards
npc.functions.r2_villagers.maegos_1.3: STAY AWAY FROM ME! YOU WILL NEVER TAKE MY FLESH! Oh wait ... you are not one of them. What are you doing all the way down here?
npc.functions.r2_villagers.maegos_1.7: Um ... I came here to hunt for treasures. Don't worry, I have no interest in your flesh. Now tell me, what is this place?
npc.functions.r2_villagers.maegos_1.10: What are you waiting for!? Rescue them, before it's too late! The slaughterhouse is to the east, across the molten river.
npc.functions.r2_villagers.maegos_1.12: Thank you for saving everyone! Cinderkeep is forever in your debt.
npc.functions.r2_villagers.maegos_2.3: This is Cinderkeep, the last bastion of sanity in these infernal depths. Or at least it used to be. A few days ago, the cannibals managed to break through our barricades. I escaped just in time, but when I came back, most of the other villagers were gone! Abducted by the cannibals ...
npc.functions.r2_villagers.maegos_2.7: That does not sound good. Is there anything I can do to help?
npc.functions.r2_villagers.maegos_3.3: I am afraid you can't. The cannibals must have brought them to their slaughterhouse, across the molten river to the east. You would have to be crazy to go anywhere near that place.
npc.functions.r2_villagers.maegos_3.7: Trust me, I have seen some pretty bad places. I will make my way to the slaughterhouse, maybe there is still time to save some of the villagers.
npc.functions.r2_villagers.maegos_4.3: You are braver than you look! I'm sure if you save their lives, they will be forever grateful.
npc.functions.r2_villagers.maegos_4.5: ( !!! QUEST !!! ) SAVE THE VILLAGERS TO OBTAIN REWARDS AND UNLOCK TRADERS
Come take a look at my rune collection! You won't find them anywhere else ... I made sure of that.
npc.functions.shade_black.1a.3: I still remember when you were a young and naive adventurer, clumsily scouring the overworld for minor treasures. Now look how far you have come, thanks to my wisdom and guidance!
npc.functions.shade_black.1a.7: Thanks, I guess. Do you have any more of that 'wisdom and guidance' to bestow upon me, or did you just come here to boast?
npc.functions.shade_black.2a.3: Do you notice anything? Feeling more powerful than usual? That would be the sculk veins you are standing on!
npc.functions.shade_black.2a.7: I see. Anything else I should look out for?
npc.functions.shade_black.3a.3: You are approaching the deepest and most ancient part of the abyss. This place is said to be the home of the Black Crystal, the most powerful and mysterious artifact in the underworld.
npc.functions.shade_black.3a.7: Sounds cryptic and ominous. I'm sure it will look fabulous on the Monument ...
npc.functions.shade_black_2.a2.3: This may surprise you because it never happens, but ... I have no idea. It looks like something has quite literally torn reality apart, removing pieces of our world while pulling in some parts of the void. Concerning!
npc.functions.shade_black_2.a2.7: That is putting it mildly. Any idea what is causing all this ungodly chaos?
npc.functions.shade_black_2.a3.3: I have a suspicion, but I need to learn more to be sure. Why don't you glide past that tear in reality and see what is on the other side?
npc.functions.shade_black_2.a3.7: I don't see what could possibly go wrong ...
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.1.3: As I suspected! It appears that the Black Crystal has developed a life of its own, eating up our reality and merging it with the void. It's going to take a great deal of effort to defeat it.
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.1.7: I'm used to picking up crystals, not fighting them.
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.1.10: What are you waiting for? Bring the Black Crystal back to the Nexus before it comes back to life and pulls your soul into the eternal void.
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.a2.3: You will have to use the powers of the void against itself. Did you bring any Sculk Shards?
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.a2.7: I will use them wisely. So ... how do I actually damage the Crystal? Punch it until it breaks?
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.a3.3: What a terrible idea. I sense a strong connection between the Crystal and some of the powerful voidtouched Elite creatures roaming this realm. Slaying these creatures may cause tiny cracks to appear on the surface of the Crystal. Aim for those cracks with your arrows, and you may be able to hit the exposed core of the Crystal.
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.a3.7: That sounds oddly specific, but I will try to remember your advice.
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.a4.3: Good luck, young friend! May the powers of the void have mercy on you!
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.b2.3: How can I use these sculk shards that I have found?
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.b2.8: Can you explain how I can actually damage the crystal?
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.b3.3: See those green orbs on the left? Why don't you try punching them? That strategy has worked quite well for you in the past.
npc.functions.shade_black_boss.b4.3: I sense a strong connection between the Crystal and some of the powerful voidtouched Elite creatures roaming this realm. Slaying these creatures may cause tiny cracks to appear on the surface of the Crystal. Aim for those cracks with your arrows, and you may be able to hit the exposed core of the Crystal.
npc.functions.shade_crypt.1a.3: Good, you have finally made it! I was getting bored waiting for you in here.
npc.functions.shade_crypt.1a.7: I'm sorry, I was busy smiting hordes of undead creatures and necromancers. I was hoping to find the crystal in here, but apparently I was mistaken.
npc.functions.shade_crypt.1b.3: What are you waiting for? Banish the ten immortal Crystal Keepers by pushing them back into the void! That is the only way to destroy the magical barrier protecting the Red Crystal.
npc.functions.shade_crypt.2a.3: Oh no, you were right in your assumption, but there is one more obstacle ahead: The Crypt Keeper!
npc.functions.shade_crypt.2a.7: So just one more enemy to slay? That does not sound too bad ...
npc.functions.shade_crypt.3a.3: Easier said than done! The Crypt Keeper is by far the most powerful enemy you have faced so far. He can cast a wide variety of powerful spells and summon legions of undead minions. Worse than that, he can teleport himself to another location when he feels threatened, so you might have to chase him all the way to the other end of the Crypt.
npc.functions.shade_crypt.3a.7: Sounds quite intimidating. Is there anything you can do to help me?
npc.functions.shade_crypt.4_end.3: If I had fingers, I'd cross them for you!
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.1.3: I see you are trying to get to the abyss, the deepest part of the underworld. Unfortunately, the path to the abyss has been closed forever. Centuries ago, the ancestors constructed an impenetrable gate which is protected by a mechanical monstrosity: The Gatekeeper.
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.1.7: There must be a way to open that gate. Maybe a key of some sort?
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.1.11: Hey Shade, I forgot how I was supposed to destroy the Gatekeeper. Just hit him with a sword?
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.1.14: Looks like you managed to destroy the Gatekeeper after all. The abyss is wating ...
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.a2.3: A key? No, that would be rather boring and repetitive. The only way to get past the gate is to destroy the Gatekeeper.
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.a2.7: And how do I do that?
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.a3.3: Maybe you can overload the Gatekeeper's circuits by connecting it to a redstone block using redstone dust. This should turn off it's shield and make it vulnerable for a few seconds. You can use these brief periods of vulnerability to shoot arrows at the power core on top of its head!
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.a3.5: No no no ... you can overload the Gatekeeper's circuits by connecting it to a redstone block using redstone dust. This should turn off its shield and make it vulnerable for a few seconds. You can use these brief periods of vulnerability to shoot arrows at the power core on top of its head!
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.a3.9: Great! Sounds simple enough. Let me go ahead and bring some redstone blocks ...
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.a4.3: I'm afraid it's not that easy! While you can bring redstone-transmitting items like redstone dust and repeaters, this will not work for redstone blocks. The ancestors have created an aura that automatically removes any items that generate redstone power from your inventory as soon as you enter the room below.
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.a4.7: So how am I supposed to generate power?
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.a5.3: I don't know. Why don't you just jump down there and figure it out by yourself?
npc.functions.shade_gatekeeper.a5.7: Great, I love jumping into a pit of death without knowing what to do ...
npc.functions.shade_ghorgona.1.3: Behold! The nest of Ghorgona, the ancient spider queen!
npc.functions.shade_ghorgona.1.7: Sounds icky. I should probably turn around ...
npc.functions.shade_ghorgona.2.3: Wait! Don't leave! Don't you want to steal the invaluable treasures that Ghorgona is guarding? I've been watching you slice your way through hordes of monsters, I'm sure you can take her! And if not ... at least it will be entertaining to watch you struggle for your life!
npc.functions.shade_ghorgona.2.7: Thank you Shade, your concern for my well-being is truly heartwarming. Do you at least have any advice on how to defeat her?
npc.functions.shade_ghorgona.3.3: Ghorgona is heavily armoured, so it is almost impossible to hurt her directly. However, destroying her eggs before they hatch might enrage her, making her stronger but also more vulnerable. I could tell you more, but what would be the fun in that?
npc.functions.shade_ghorgona.3.7: I fully understand. Your entertainment is clearly more important than my safety ...
npc.functions.shade_green.1.3: What a pleasure to see you here,
npc.functions.shade_green.1.4: . Do you want to know a fun fact about the snow and ice in this area?
npc.functions.shade_green.2.3: This area is incredibly cold, and walking on snow or ice will slow you down quite a bit ...
npc.functions.shade_green.2.7: That does not sound fun at all ...
npc.functions.shade_green.3.3: ... however, most of the monsters in this area thrive in the cold, and they are completely invulnerable while they are standing on top of ice or snow.
npc.functions.shade_green.3.7: I'm still waiting for the fun part ...
npc.functions.shade_green.4.3: ... so I hope you brought a shovel!
npc.functions.shade_green.4.7: A shovel? Isn't there a more convenient way to remove the ice and snow?
npc.functions.shade_green.5.3: After studying the inner workings of the world for centuries, I have come to the conclusion that fire will melt ice and snow. I'm sure you have managed to find some magical items that can set things on fire, those will surely be handy.
npc.functions.shade_green.5.7: Use fire skills to melt ice and snow, got it ...
npc.functions.shade_magma_cart.1.3: You know, in a place like this I am glad that I am an ethereal spirit entity that is unaffected by ambient temperature. How are you doing?
npc.functions.shade_magma_cart.2.3: Great! See that mineshaft over there? That is where it starts to get reaaaaally cold.
npc.functions.shade_magma_cart.2.7: Sounds like I need to bring a lot of firewood.
npc.functions.shade_magma_cart.3.3: I'm afraid that is not enough. See these minecarts loaded with magma blocks? Those should provide enough heat as long as you stay within a few meters of them. You might have to repair the rails if you want to push the cart all the way to the end of the mineshaft though.
npc.functions.shade_magma_cart.3.7: I see. What if I run out of minecarts?
npc.functions.shade_magma_cart.4.3: See that button? You can construct new minecarts for the price of 10 Lapis.
npc.functions.shade_magma_cart.4.7: Let's hope that won't be necessary ...
npc.functions.shade_map_end.1a.3: Congratulations! I knew you could do it.
npc.functions.shade_map_end.1a.7: Thank you, my friend. It was a long and arduous journey. And even though I feel like all of this was just entertainment to you, I must thank you for helping me during my adventure.
npc.functions.shade_map_end.2a.3: Oh, stop it! If I had tear glands, I would start crying right now.
npc.functions.shade_map_end.2a.7: You know, Shade ... you must be the most powerful entity I have ever encountered, and I feel like I don't know anything about you. One day, you need to tell me who you really are.
npc.functions.shade_map_end.3a.3: One day, my friend, but not today. We will meet again for your next adventure!
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.1.3: Behold! You are about to enter the cave of the mighty Metamorph. Be warned!
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.1.7: You don't typically warn me before I enter a new area. Should I be concerned?
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.1.14: What are you coming back here for? Just jump down the hole in the middle of the arena to get to the infernal depths. And tell my old friend Maegos I said 'Hi'!
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.a2.3: The Metamorph is far more dangerous than any other enemy you have ever encountered. Unfortunately, it is blocking the path to the deeper level of underworld, so you'll have to get past it.
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.a3.3: The Metamorph can shapeshift into different creatures, and each shape has unique attacks and defensive abilities. Oh, and beware of its aura of immunity ... while the Metamorph is glowing, it is immune to all spells and damage.
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.a3.7: And how do I break through that aura of immunity?
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.a4.3: When you get close enough to the Metamorph, it might let its guard down and lose its shield. Or maybe it won't, in which case it will overwhelm you, devour your body, and spit out your bones to decorate its cave. Only one way to find out!
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.b3.5: While in Zoglin form, the metamorph is most vulnerable while it is charging up certain attacks. In these brief periods, it stays still and cannot attack. This is the best time to attack the Metamorph!
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.b3.7: While in Phantom form, the Metamorph is no longer immune to arrows, but it is immune to all damage (= glowing)  while no player is nearby. The safest way to attack it is to shoot it with arrows right after it loses immunity.
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.b3.9: You can use blocks to build additional barriers inside the arena. This helps break line of sight, interrupting the high-damage guardian beam.
npc.functions.shade_metamorph.b3.10: The Metamorph can morph into different creatures. Each shapeshift is triggered by the Metamorph's health dropping below a certain value. Once a new phase has started, it cannot morph back to its previous form.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.cra_1.3: This is the Runeforge, an ancient and powerful tool that allows you to craft and repair magic items.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.cra_1.7: Thanks, but I already know how to craft and repair items ...
npc.functions.shade_nexus.cra_2.3: Forget everything you know! If you want to survive in the underworld, you must master the Runeforge. You start by placing a weapon, tool, or armor item in the middle, just as if you would equip an armor stand. Are you following me?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.cra_3.3: You can use runes to turn basic items into magical ones. Each item can have no more than one prefix, one suffix, and one upgrade. Simply place the appropriate runes on the netherite blocks, then press the button to complete the crafting!
npc.functions.shade_nexus.cra_3.7: That sounds simple enough. What's the catch?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.cra_4.3: It's not free of charge! Crafting requires rare materials such as Lapis Lazuli. Some powerful runes can only be used if you possess a certain amount of 'Rune Power'. You will see what that means soon enough.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.cra_4.7: I see. What about repairing? Some of my gear has taken quite a beating over the last few hours.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.cra_5.3: If the item that you place on the Runeforge is damaged, you cannot use it for crafting, but you will be able to repair it instead. Repairing an item costs experience as well as materials. The more powerful the item, the more costly it is to repair.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.cra_5.7: That's quite a lot to remember. Can you write that down for me?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.cra_6.3: Seriously? Here, let me leave this for you. Just try it out, it is easier than it sounds.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_a1.3: See that structure behind me? This is the Monument! Isn't it beautiful?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_a1.7: I've seen more impressive things on my journey here.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_a2.3: You are missing the point! It's not about what it looks like, it's about what it represents! As you progress on your great adventure, you can complete the Monument by replacing the stained glass blocks with 'crystals' of the same color!
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_a3.3: To track your progress, of course! These crystals are hidden in some of the most perilous places in the underworld. Each one is harder to conquer than the one before. Only a truly exceptional adventurer can find all 16 crystals and complete the Monument!
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_a3.7: You are saying I should risk my life searching for crystals so I can complete a Monument just to prove to myself how great of an adventurer I am?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_a4.3: Precisely! And do you see the other, smaller Monument over there? That is the Bonus Monument! You can craft emerald blocks and put them in place of the lime stained glass blocks! The gods of the Jungle love Emeralds, so they will probably reward you for that!
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_a4.7: Got it, complete the Bonus Monument to stroke my own ego even more ...
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_a5.3: You are a fast learner. Is there anything else you would like to learn about?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_a5.7: How do I find the next area?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_b1.3: You look like you have a question ...
npc.functions.shade_nexus.mon_b2.3: The path next to the Nexus leads to the Reeking Ravine. The access to the underworld is on the other side of the Ravine. I must leave now, I'm sure you will be able to handle it from here!
npc.functions.shade_nexus.out_1.3: Welcome to the Nexus! This used to be my home, and now it shall be yours.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.out_1.7: This is not the mysterious hidden underworld that you have promised me. Why did you lead me here?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.out_2.3: You will see soon enough. And do not worry, the access to the hidden world is not far.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.pearl_1.3: Have you ever wondered what happens to the souls of the creatures that you slay during your journey?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.pearl_2.3: Well, I don't really know where these souls go, but I know how to catch them! Take a look over there on the left, and take one of the 'Soul Catchers' out of the item frame!
npc.functions.shade_nexus.pearl_2.7: Why would I want to collect souls? That sounds a little macabre.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.pearl_3.3: You see, after collecting at least 50 souls, you will be able to summon a portal that brings you right back to this room. You can go back and forth as often as you like.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.pearl_3.7: How convenient! And how many of these portals can I summon?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.pearl_4.3: Anytime you create a new portal, the old one will be replaced. Oh, and the magic powers that create the portal are a bit ... jittery. You cannot summon a portal when enemies are nearby, or when you are inside of certain areas.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.pearl_4.7: That doesn't sound too bad. I will try it out!
npc.functions.shade_nexus.spe2_1.3: Interesting! These colorful orbs seem to radiate with unspeakable power, as if they have been placed here by the Gods themselves. YOU SHOULD TRY PUNCHING THEM AND SEE WHAT HAPPENS!
npc.functions.shade_nexus.spe2_1.7: Why is punching things always the solution to every problem in this world? Anyways, I might just follow your advice against my better judgement ...
npc.functions.shade_nexus.spe_1.4: So, Shade ... what is this room over there behind you, and why does it seem to be locked?
npc.functions.shade_nexus.spe_2.3: Oh, that? It's a ... secret room containing ... many secret things! Such an amazing mystery!
npc.functions.shade_nexus.spe_2.7: You know, Shade, you can just tell me if you don't know the answer to my question. I won't judge ...
npc.functions.shade_nexus.tel_1.3: As you explore the underworld, portals will open in this room. These portals will allow you to travel back and forth between different locations. I call this room the Travel-Everywhere-Back-and-Forth-Room.
npc.functions.shade_nexus.tel_1.7: Um ... I see. I think I'll just call it 'Teleporter Hub' instead.
npc.functions.shade_ninja.1.4: , I see your face and I sense a distinct lack of frustration and suffering. We should do something about that!
npc.functions.shade_ninja.1.11: To beat Xin's challenge, you must slay the four undead senseis in less than four minutes. Simply walk through the hallway past the red dust, and the timer will start. See you again when you fail!
npc.functions.shade_ninja.1.15: Thank you for the vote of confidence, Shade ...
npc.functions.shade_ninja.1.18: ! You are more agile than you look.
npc.functions.shade_ninja.a2.3: Behind this hallway, you will find an ancient arena that was once built by Grandmaster Xin. All living creatures inside the arena are granted Jump Boost, but they are prevented from breaking or placing blocks. Those who beat Xin's challenge will be showered in exquisite treasures beyond their imagination.
npc.functions.shade_ninja.a3.3: You must use your agility to jump from platform to platform, find the four undead senseis, and slay them in less than four minutes. If you fall, die, or run out of time, you will be transported back to this room.
npc.functions.shade_ninja.a3.7: That sounds simple enough. How do I start this challenge?
npc.functions.shade_ninja.a4.3: Simply walk through the hallway past the red dust, and the timer will start. See you again when you fail!
npc.functions.shade_obsidian.1a.3: You have made it to the Obsidian Gate. Did you bring the key?
npc.functions.shade_obsidian.2a.3: The two halves of the key are hidden in two separate locations, somewhere nearby. You need to combine both halves to open the Obsidian Gate.
npc.functions.shade_obsidian.2a.7: 'Somewhere nearby'? Can you be a little more specific?
npc.functions.shade_obsidian.3a.3: I can ... for a price! For 20 Lapis, I will sell you two compasses which point you to the two halves of the Obsidian Key. Or you could you explore this area and find them yourself.
npc.functions.shade_obsidian.3a.7: What do you even need Lapis for? Fine, I'll pay!
npc.functions.shade_obsidian.buy_compass: This compass points to the location of
the left half of the obsidian key.
the right half of the obsidian key.
npc.functions.shade_red.1a.3: I see you have made it through the soul gate. Here is where things get serious!
npc.functions.shade_red.1a.7: Fantastic! I was worried I was never going to encounter a real challenge ...
npc.functions.shade_red.2a.3: The red crystal is protected by an impenetrable, arcane barrier. There are ten ancient, immortal creatures called 'Crystal Keepers', who are maintaining the barrier with their powerful spell. You might have to get rid of them somehow.
npc.functions.shade_red.2a.7: I'm sorry, did you just say 'immortal'?
npc.functions.shade_red.3a.3: You are such a good listener! Yes, they are indeed immortal, but that does not mean that you cannot dispose of them in other ways. Try to banish them from this realm by pushing them back into the deep, dark void from which they once came.
npc.functions.shade_red.3a.7: And you are sure that will keep them away forever?
npc.functions.shade_red.4a.3: Either that, or they will one day return as vengeful spirits to torment your soul with an eternity of immeasurable pain. Only one way to find out!
npc.functions.shade_start.1.3: Thank you, stranger! I have been trapped in here for countless centuries. At last, I am free.
npc.functions.shade_start.1.7: That's ... great. Unfortunately, I have no idea who you are.
npc.functions.shade_start.2.3: I am the eternal, disembodied Shade of the great ... actually, you know what, just call me 'Shade' for now! And who might you be?
npc.functions.shade_start.2.7: Just a humble adventurer looking for treasure. How did you end up in here?
npc.functions.shade_start.3.3: No need to concern yourself with that! You said you were looking for treasure. What if I told you there is an entire world hidden beneath the ground, full of ancient treasures leftover by long-forgotten civilizations?
npc.functions.shade_start.3.7: That sounds just like the kind of adventure I am looking for. How do I find this mysterious place?
npc.functions.shade_start.after_tp_a1.3: It feels good to finally use my powers again!
npc.functions.shade_start.after_tp_a1.7: Wait, did you just teleport yourself?
npc.functions.shade_start.after_tp_a2.3: You are easily impressed, young adventurer. The things you seek are behind this door. Let me open it for you.
npc.functions.shade_start.after_tp_a2.7: You seem to be quite invested in my adventure. This must be my lucky day ...
npc.functions.shade_start.after_tp_b1.3: There we go, the path to the Nexus is clear! Well ... except for the terrifying monsters that will try to tear you apart on the way there. But I'm sure those will be no problem for you.
npc.functions.shade_start.after_tp_b1.7: How reassuring! I can tell that you care deeply about my wellbeing.
npc.functions.shade_start.punch.5: Just like in real life, you can start a conversation by punching someone in the face.
npc.functions.shade_start.start.5: Who is this!? Are you here to save me? Please, come here! The magic barrier can only be broken from the outside.
npc.functions.shade_trustfall.1.3: See that hole that looks like it leads into a bottomless pit? That's the abyss, the deepest part of the underworld. Jump into it!
npc.functions.shade_trustfall.1.7: I'm sorry, did you just tell me to jump into it?
npc.functions.shade_trustfall.2.3: Yes! Trust me, it's completely safe.
npc.functions.shade_trustfall.2.7: It wouldn't be the craziest thing I've ever done ...
npc.functions.shade_void.1.7: Oh wow ... I had no idea what that portal would lead to, but this is certainly not what I expected. What is this place?
npc.functions.shade_void.1.11: I'm ready. Let the battle commence!
npc.functions.shade_void.1_2.3: A place that defies the laws of nature. A dark realm scarcely connected to your reality by unstable portals like that one you apparently stumbled your way into.
npc.functions.shade_void.1_2.7: And what is this ominous-looking black sphere behind you in the distance?
npc.functions.shade_void.1_3.3: Legend has it that some sadistic godlike entity once created three giant arenas inside the void, each of them protected by a powerful sphere of dark energy. Any hero who is strong enough to destroy all three void sphere would reap rewards beyond their imagination.
npc.functions.shade_void.1_3.7: You had me at 'rewards'. How do I enter these arenas?
npc.functions.shade_void.1_4.3: I can use my powers to teleport you to the arena right across from here. To acess the other two arenas, you must find the other two portals in the underworld.
npc.functions.shade_void.1_4.7: How convenient! You said I must destroy the void spheres. Any idea how I can do that? Do I just hit it with my sword and hope it breaks?
npc.functions.shade_void.1_5.3: Don't be silly! Obviously you need to kill the five void specters in less than four minutes, and the void sphere will implode by itself.
npc.functions.shade_void.1_5.7: Obviously! But what if I run out of time? Four minutes sounds like quite a challenge.
npc.functions.shade_void.1_6.3: When four minutes are over, the void will simply bring you back to this little floating island.
npc.functions.shade_void.1_7.3: Enough talk. Are you ready to face the arena?
npc.functions.shade_void.1_7.7: I don't think I'm ready yet. Let me come back later.

skills.functions.chest.agony_explain.3: The damage from this aura stacks with other damage over time, such as Wither and Bleed.
skills.functions.chest.agony_explain.5: The following effects count as 'Debuffs': Wither, Poison, Slowness, Weakness, Levitation, Vulnerability, Decay, Flammability, and being frozen.
skills.functions.potions.potion_10_trigg: This enemy is immune to spells and magic potions.

skills.functions.sword.eruption_fail.1: Not enough space to create an eruption!
spec.functions.archer.tell.3: All players have a 30% chance of finding an arrow on kill, and all critical arrows fired by players have +1 level of Power
spec.functions.archer.tell.4: (Place 'Gift of the Gods' in item frame to unlock this specialization)
spec.functions.bounty_hunter.tell.3: All players have Luck I, which increases the loot gained from kills by 30%. In addition, killing an Elite enemy restores 2♥.
spec.functions.brawler.tell.3: All players gain 1 mana on kill if they have taken damage in the last 6 s.
spec.functions.healer.tell.3: All players have Regeneration I while below 6♥.
spec.functions.maester.tell.3: All players have their spell cooldown reduced by 20%.
spec.functions.miner.tell.3: All players have Haste I while holding a pickaxe.

src4.graves.functions.totem.explain.1: The totem calls out for lost souls, but none answer...
src4.graves.functions.totem.explain.2: If you ever lose your belongings, come back to this place.
